item.title: Regex in Languages
item.description: Perl $foo =~ /$pattern/ Match groups $&, $1, ... Replace $string =~ s/pattern/replacement/g; Reference https://perldoc.perl.org/perlre.html Go import ("regexp") match, _ := regexp.MatchString("pattern", "string") Capture var r = regexp.MustCompile(`pattern`) fmt.Println(r.FindStringSubmatch("string")) // => [group0, group1] fmt.Println(r.MatchAllString("string1, string2", -1)) // => [string1, string2] Replace newString := r.RelaceAllString("oldString", "replacement") Reference https://golang.org/pkg/regexp/ https://gobyexample.com/regular-expressions Ruby 'string' =~ /pattern/ /pattern/ =~ 'string' m = 'string'.match(/pattern/) Match groups m[1] Replace 'string'.
